com.hippikon.security
Class MutablePermissionSet

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.DefaultPermissionSet
      com.hippikon.security.MutablePermissionSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
PermissionSet, java.io.Serializable
public class MutablePermissionSet
extends DefaultPermissionSet

The MutablePermissionSet class provides an implementation of the PermissionSet interface that may be manipulated by Policy implementations.

This class has no public API and is used internally to implement authorization logic within the security authorization framework.

Policy subclasses may use this object during the Policy.doFinal(PermissionSet) method in order to affect change prior to returning a PermissionSet object back to the PermissionsFactory.

The only way a new instance of this class may be created is through the Policy.createMutablePermissionSet(PermissionSet) method that all Policy subclasses inherit.

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:

Author:
Dale Churchett

Constructor Detail

MutablePermissionSet

protected MutablePermissionSet(int flags)
Creates a new MutablePermissionSet with initial int value.

Parameters:
flags - an int value representing the binary set of permission flags

MutablePermissionSet

protected MutablePermissionSet(java.lang.String aclString)
Creates a new MutablePermissionSet instance with initial permissions value. See DefaultPermissionSet.

Parameters:
aclString - a String represenation of a permission set

MutablePermissionSet

protected MutablePermissionSet(PermissionSet perms)
Creates a new MutablePermissionSet with initial integer value based on the permissions of another PermissionSet object.

Parameters:
perms - a PermissionSet object to deep-copy

MutablePermissionSet

protected MutablePermissionSet()
Creates a new MutablePermissionSet with no flags enabled.
